page.title: 19Education 1
page.content: There are 2 small primary schools. These are Crowton School and Norley School. Both of these are Church schools. Norley is controlled by Cheshire County Council while Crowton is an aided school. Crowton School is built alongside the main B5153 Northwich to Frodsham road. It is modern in design and has 3 teaching areas and its own kitchen. There is a football field and playground space which is marked out for girls netball. When they leave Crowton School the children then go to Weaverham High School approximately 3 miles away. Some of the children do not go to either primary school, but are sent to private school.
